DOC.brief_summary: SPECIFIC AIM The aim study determine increase calcium intake recommend level dairy food adolescent female habitually low calcium intake above-the-median body mass index ( BMI ) sex age decrease body fat gain compare similar female continue low calcium intake . . HYPOTHESIS Post-menarcheal adolescent girl habitually low calcium intake consume dairy food provide least 1200 mg calcium per day small increase percent body fat , measure dual energy absorptiometry , one year post-menarcheal adolescent girl usual diet 600 mg calcium per day less .
DOC.brief_title: Adequate Dairy Intake Weight Change Girls
DOC.criteria: Age 1314 year old ( must age consent sign ) Above 50th percentile BMI Above 85th percentile BMI approval primary physician At least one one half year post menarche Habitual dietary calcium intake 600mg/d less assessed 3 day diet diary . This inclusive supplemental calcium dietary intake . Willingness increase dietary calcium ( low fat [ skim , 1 % , 2 % ] milk yogurt ) one year Menarche prior age 10 History lactose intolerance milk allergy Weight > 300 pound BMI > 97 percentile age gender Pregnancy Chronic disease disorder like diabetes , polycystic ovarian syndrome , thyroid disease , seizures cancer ( cancer ok > 10 year ) Use steroid like prednisone , prednisolone , hydrocortisone , Flovent , Advair , Nasonex Use weight reduce medication like Meredia , alli , Dexatrim Xenical Use contraceptives like Yasmin , Ortho TriCyclen , Apri , Aviane DepoProvera reason , include acne ( see inclusive list ) Use acne medication like Accutane high dose Vitamin A Use ADHD medication like Adderall , Ritalin , Concerta . ( Per Dr. RamaswamyStraterra OK ) ( see inclusive list ) Use seizure medication like Lamictal Phenobarb ( see inclusive list ) Use antidepressant like Prozac Effexor ( see inclusive list ) Diagnosed eat disorder Dieting behavior weight loss > 10 pound last 3 month ( IF YES , consult Project Manager ) Metal skeleton ( pin , rod , etc ) Sibling child dietary study last 5 year Total body BMC Zscore 2.0 baseline Participating ongoing research protocol
